article.description: Tre' McLean had 14 points and 10 rebounds for his second double-double of the season and Chattanooga led wire-to-wire in a 73-57 victory over Jacksonville State on Wednesday.
article.headline: Chattanooga leads wire-to-wire, tops Jacksonville St. 73-57
article.linkText: Chattanooga leads wire-to-wire, tops Jacksonville St. 73-57
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. -- Tre' McLean had 14 points and 10 rebounds for his second double-double of the season and Chattanooga led wire-to-wire in a 73-57 victory over Jacksonville State on Wednesday. Chattanooga scored the first nine points and held an 11-point lead at halftime. The second half started in a similar way as the Mocs scored 10 straight -- with six from Justin Tuoyo -- to extend their advantage to 47-26. The lead didn't dip below 14 points after that and the Mocs led by as many as 29. McLean, Greg Pryor and Johnathan Burroughs-Cook each made two 3-pointers and finished with 14 points apiece for Chattanooga (9-3). The Mocs were 9 of 19 from distance to conclude their non-conference schedule. Malcolm Drumwright led Jacksonville State (7-7) with 14 points and eight rebounds. The Gamecocks, which had won two straight road games, have seven wins prior to New Year's Day for the first time since the 2013-14 season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
